channel.title: iOS Dev Break
channel.description: iOS Dev Break: 15 minutes of current events, tips, and advice for iOS Developers! Including, but not limited to, discussions of Swift, iOS, watchOS, and tvOS development.
channel.itunes:author: Evan K. Stone
channel.itunes:summary: iOS Dev Break: 15 minutes of current events, tips, and advice for iOS Developers! Including, but not limited to, discussions of Swift, iOS, watchOS, and tvOS development.
channel.itunes:subtitle: iOS Dev Break: 15 minutes of current events, tips, and advice for iOS Developers.

item.title: Not That Kind of Dependency Management - IDB049
item.itunes:title: Not That Kind of Dependency Management - IDB049
item.description: In this episode: Juno for visionOS removed from the App Store—what does it mean for developers? Also: Patreon news and update, as well as Swift Remote Studio Coworking BETA!
item.content:encoded: In this episode: Juno for visionOS removed from the App Store—what does it mean for developers? Also: Patreon news and update, as well as Swift Remote Studio Coworking BETA!

item.itunes:summary: In this episode: Juno for visionOS removed from the App Store—what does it mean for developers? Also: Patreon news and update, as well as Swift Remote Studio Coworking BETA!

item.title: It's Glowtime with Josh Hrach - IDB048
item.itunes:title: It's Glowtime with Josh Hrach - IDB048
item.description:
In this episode, Evan and Josh discuss the latest products announced at the "It's Glowtime" Apple event that happened on September 9, 2024, and their implications and importance to iOS developers.

Show Links

  • Josh Hrach's Mastodon Account
  • Random Projects Website
  • Apple Developer - Enhancing your app experience with the Camera Control
  • Apple HIG - Camera Control

item.title: Vision Pro Labs and Wonderlust - IDB045
item.itunes:title: Vision Pro Labs and Wonderlust - IDB045
item.description:
We're back! Evan relates what he can about his experience with the Apple Vision Pro labs held at Apple, and discusses the Apple September "Wonderlust" Event and the Swift Remote Studio viewing party taking place that morning!

item.title: WWDC 2023 Keynote Wrap-Up Mega Episode!
item.itunes:title: WWDC 2023 Keynote Wrap-Up Mega Episode!
item.description:
Evan is joined by Josh Hrach from Random Projects and developer of DoMarks! Listen as they give their reactions to all of the exciting new releases from Apple's WWDC 2023 Keynote.

Show Links

WWDC 2023 - Apple Developer

item.title: The AirPods that Cried Wolf - IDB043
item.itunes:title: The AirPods that Cried Wolf - IDB043
item.description:
WWDC 2023 is next week! In this episode, Evan shares a couple of the things that he would like to see from next week's Keynote and SwiftUI. Also a quick tip to prepare for next week's event, and a Swift Remote Studio watch party!

Show Links

Apple Developer App Bookmark Removal - Leo G. Dion Twitter Post

DetailsPro - Apple App Store

Anticipation and Expectations: MartianCraft Staff Gear Up for WWDC ’23

Swift Remote Studio

item.title: 15 Minutes a Day - IDB038
item.itunes:title: 15 Minutes a Day - IDB038
item.description:
We are back! In this episode, we'll explore some benefits of SwiftUI and see how you can improve your skills in simple ways. Also a productivity tip/pick for helping you create and export all the app icons you need for your app!

Show Links

Apply Pixels iOS 14 Icon Template

How to use the iOS App Icon Template for Sketch

Swipe up to bring up the dock in iPad Simulator - Apple Developer Forums

https://www.hackingwithswift.com/100

https://www.hackingwithswift.com/100/swiftui

item.title: The SwiftUI is Happening. - IDB037
item.itunes:title: The SwiftUI is Happening. - IDB037
item.description:
In this episode: Do App Clips have a place in the iOS ecosystem? Can SwiftUI improve productivity? Clicking and dragging got you down? Listen and find out more!

 

Show Links

Transformation Apps Website

Cult of Mac - App Clips and Phoenix 2

Phoenix 2 - Official Site (with App Clip)

Jesse Squires - How to fix the incomprehensible tabs in Xcode 12

 

Support the Show!

iOS Dev Break Patreon Page

You can also help the show by giving it a good rating in the Podcasts app or podcast app of your choice.

item.title: Bye, Bye, Storyboards! - IDB036
item.itunes:title: Bye, Bye, Storyboards! - IDB036
item.description:

MadMachine - SwiftIO

RECaf - Effortless Caffeine Tracking

item.title: WWDC 2020 Will Mac Your Dreams Come True - IDB034
item.itunes:title: WWDC 2020 Will Mac Your Dreams Come True - IDB034
item.description: WWDC 2020 is starting June 22, and Apple has a very nice surprise for you and your Mac. Also: do you like to dive right into coding when solving a problem? Have you tried sketching it out?

item.title: Brand Experience - IDB029
item.itunes:title: Brand Experience - IDB029
item.description:
What is Brand Experience? Why you should care as an iOS developer? Find out in this week's episode of iOS Dev Break!

Also: MacBook Pro news, GDPR and CloudKit, a macOS Mojave tip, and a new pick for this week's show!

 

Show Links

What makes your Brand Experience better? UX or CX?

Apple announces new MacBook Pros with a keyboard fix, oh, and more powerful processors

Apple introduces first 8-core MacBook Pro, the fastest Mac notebook ever

MacBook Pro 15" Touch Bar 2019 Teardown

GDPR & CloudKit

How to Use Only a Dark Menu Bar and Dock in macOS Mojave

WWDC for macOS

Apple announces new MacBook Pros with a keyboard fix, oh, and more powerful processors Apple introduces first 8-core MacBook Pro, the fastest Mac notebook ever MacBook Pro 15" Touch Bar 2019 Teardown GDPR & CloudKit How to Use Only a Dark Menu Bar and Dock in macOS Mojave WWDC for macOS

item.itunes:title: Breaking the Fabric Umbilical Cord - IDB028
item.description: In this episode: Nest is dead, long live Google Nest. MongoDB acquires Realm. Breaking the Fabric Umbilical Cord. Plus an experiment in CX, and a pick of the show from App Builders 2019!

item.title: WWDC 2019 Announced! - IDB027
item.itunes:title: WWDC 2019 Announced! - IDB027
item.description: WWDC dates have been announced for 2019! It may be too late to get your ticket, but you can still plan to be there. Also hear topics like simplified Auto Layout and the tricky task of App Pricing, courtesy of Soor, the recently released Music app that's challenging the norm.

item.title: Playgrounds That Work. - IDB026
item.itunes:title: Playgrounds That Work. - IDB026
item.description: Tired of Xcode Playgrounds crashing on you? We've got something you're going to like! Plus: Can Apple really pull off a CloudKit and Core Data persistence solution? Also some great news and a podcast recommendation!

item.title: Code Reviews and Pomodoros - IDB025
item.itunes:title: Code Reviews and Pomodoros - IDB025
item.description:
Don't fear the code review process any longer! Make it work for you and your team! Also: Evan shares a super-simple productivity technique that will help you to improve your productivity in your coding. He also has a wish list item for the App Store... 

Thanks to Hover for sponsoring this episode!

item.title: Another Facepalm Event - IDB024
item.itunes:title: Another Facepalm Event - IDB024
item.description: Find out what's in store for Fabric! Also, learn how to fix an annoying Xcode problem resulting from downloading iOS 11.4 simulators. Would you like to run Swift without Xcode in Terminal? Try the Swift REPL. It's still a thing. Thanks to Hover for sponsoring this episode!
item.content:encoded: Find out what's in store for Fabric! Also, learn how to fix an annoying Xcode problem resulting from downloading iOS 11.4 simulators. Would you like to run Swift without Xcode in Terminal? Try the Swift REPL. It's still a thing. Thanks to Hover for sponsoring this episode!

item.title: AutoFill 'Er Up! - IDB023
item.itunes:title: AutoFill 'Er Up! - IDB023
item.description:
iOS Dev Break 023: AutoFill 'Er Up!

In this episode, you'll find out about the new way to automatically fill-in authentication security codes in iOS 12! Also: a little follow-up on debugging view hierarchies. Thanks to Hover for sponsoring this episode!
item.content:encoded:
iOS Dev Break 023: AutoFill 'Er Up!

In this episode, you'll find out about the new way to automatically fill-in authentication security codes in iOS 12! Also: a little follow-up on debugging view hierarchies. Thanks to Hover for sponsoring this episode!

item.itunes:title: Debug Your View Hierarchies - IDB022
item.description:
iOS Dev Break 022: Debug Your View Hierarchies

Learn about this very helpful tool that you may have seen lurking in Xcode but haven’t tried yet. Also some interesting news from Paul Hudson and Hacking With Swift!

item.title: Back in the Saddle Again - IDB021
item.itunes:title: Back in the Saddle Again - IDB021
item.description:
iOS Dev Break: 15 minutes of current events, tips, and advice for iOS Developers! Including, but not limited to, discussions of Swift, iOS, watchOS, and tvOS development.

iOS Dev Break 021: It is the Summer of WWDC 2018, and we are back!

In this episode: Follow-up from WWDC, news and current events, and a discussion of the current state of Xcode 9 and 10!
